com.stripe.android

Class CustomerSession

  • com.stripe.android.CustomerSession

  • public class CustomerSession

    Represents a logged-in session of a single Customer.

    See Creating ephemeral keys

    See Also:
    Creating ephemeral keys

    • Field Detail

      • Companion

        public static com.stripe.android.CustomerSession.Companion Companion

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveCurrentCustomer

        public void retrieveCurrentCustomer(@NotNull
                                    com.stripe.android.CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)

        Retrieve the current class Customer. If customer is not stale, this returns immediately with the cache. If not, it fetches a new value and returns that to the listener.

        Parameters:
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener to invoke with the result of getting thecustomer, either from the cache or from the server
        See Also:
        class Customer

      • updateCurrentCustomer

        public void updateCurrentCustomer(@NotNull
                                  com.stripe.android.CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)

        Force an update of the current customer, regardless of how much time has passed.

        Parameters:
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener to invoke with the result of gettingthe customer from the server

      • getCachedCustomer

        @Nullable
public Customer getCachedCustomer()

        A cached class Customer, or null if the current customer has expired.

        See Also:
        class Customer

      • getPaymentMethods

        @JvmOverloads
public void getPaymentMethods(@NotNull
                                            com.stripe.android.model.PaymentMethod.Type paymentMethodType,
                                            @Nullable
                                            java.lang.Integer limit,
                                            @Nullable
                                            java.lang.String endingBefore,
                                            @Nullable
                                            java.lang.String startingAfter,
                                            @NotNull
                                            com.stripe.android.CustomerSession.PaymentMethodsRetrievalListener listener)

        Retrieves all of the customer's PaymentMethod objects, filtered by a enum PaymentMethod.Type.

        See https://stripe.com/docs/api/payment_methods/list

        Parameters:
        paymentMethodType - the enum PaymentMethod.Type to filter by
        limit - Optional. A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can rangebetween 1 and 100, and the default is 10.
        endingBefore - Optional. A cursor for use in pagination. ending_before is an objectID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can includeending_before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.
        startingAfter - Optional. A cursor for use in pagination. starting_after is an objectID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_fooin order to fetch the next page of the list.
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener called when the API callcompletes with a list of class PaymentMethod objects
        See Also:
        enum PaymentMethod.Type, https://stripe.com/docs/api/payment_methods/list

      • initCustomerSession

        @JvmStatic
 @JvmOverloads
public static void initCustomerSession(@NotNull
                                                                 android.content.Context context,
                                                                 @NotNull
                                                                 EphemeralKeyProvider ephemeralKeyProvider,
                                                                 @Nullable
                                                                 java.lang.String stripeAccountId,
                                                                 boolean shouldPrefetchEphemeralKey)

        Create a CustomerSession with the provided interface EphemeralKeyProvider.

        You must call PaymentConfiguration.init with your publishable key before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        ephemeralKeyProvider - An interface EphemeralKeyProvider used to retrieveclass EphemeralKey ephemeral keys
        stripeAccountId - An optional Stripe Connect account to associate with Customer-relatedStripe API Requests. See class Stripe.
        shouldPrefetchEphemeralKey - If true, will immediately fetch an ephemeral key using{@param ephemeralKeyProvider}. Otherwise, will only fetchan ephemeral key when needed.
        See Also:
        interface EphemeralKeyProvider, PaymentConfiguration.init

      • getInstance

        @JvmStatic
 @NotNull
public static CustomerSession getInstance()

        Gets the singleton instance of class CustomerSession. If the session has not been initialized, this will throw a RuntimeException.

        Returns:
        the singleton class CustomerSession instance.
        See Also:
        class CustomerSession, RuntimeException

      • endCustomerSession

        @JvmStatic
public static void endCustomerSession()

        End the singleton instance of a class CustomerSession. Calls to getInstance will throw an IllegalStateException after this call, until the user calls initCustomerSession again.

        See Also:
        class CustomerSession, getInstance, IllegalStateException, initCustomerSession

      • cancelCallbacks

        @JvmStatic
public static void cancelCallbacks()

        Cancel any in-flight class CustomerSession operations. Their callback listeners will not be called.

        It will not clear the singleton class CustomerSession instance.

        It is not necessary to call initCustomerSession after calling cancelCallbacks.

        See Also:
        class CustomerSession, class CustomerSession, initCustomerSession, cancelCallbacks
